intents.simplified_explanation: As a consumer, you have the right to receive a refund for defective goods or unsatisfactory services. A seller cannot legally withhold your refund without valid reason.
recommended_steps: Collect all purchase receipts, order confirmations, and payment records.
Send a written refund request to the seller via email and keep a copy.
If no response in 7 days, escalate to the company's grievance officer.
File a complaint on the National Consumer Helpline at consumerhelpline.gov.in.
If unresolved, approach your District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission.

intents.intent_description: Online shopping fraud or non-delivery of product
intents.simplified_explanation: If you paid for a product online and it was never delivered, or if the platform was fraudulent, you are protected under consumer law and may also have recourse under cyber law.
recommended_steps: Save all order confirmations, payment receipts, and chat records.
Report the issue to the e-commerce platform's customer support in writing.
File a complaint at consumerhelpline.gov.in with all evidence.

intents.intent_description: Poor service quality or service not provided

Contact the service provider in writing explaining the deficiency.
Request a resolution — either completion of service or refund.

For cyber issues: visit cybercrime.gov.in or call helpline 1930.
For criminal matters: visit your nearest police station with written complaint.
Always carry evidence — receipts, screenshots, messages — when filing.
